title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: China’s Rising Naval Dominance Threatens U.S. Commerce And Safety
items.description: China’s race to be a maritime superpower presents the greatest threat to the U.S. since the British burned down the White House in 1814.

items.title: Young Canadians Voted Against Spending Orgy, But Their Insulated Parents Won
items.description: Younger Canadians stuck living with their parents and unable to afford starting families supported the Conservative Party. Liberals won.

items.title: Bill Gates says lack of climate cooperation is unlikely to last
items.description: Unwinding global collaborations to address climate change “works against us,” Gates said.

items.title: Powell won’t cut interest rates on Wednesday, Wharton’s Jeremy Siegel says. He suspects attacks on the Fed chair will escalate
items.description: “Powell is not going to do anything,” Siegel said in an interview. “Trump, I think, is going to step up the escalation,” he said later.

items.title: Trump says Stephen Miller at top of the list for national security adviser
items.description: President Trump said Deputy Chief of Staff for Policy Stephen Miller is the leading contender to fill the role of national security adviser.

items.title: Democrat Hank Johnson draws Holocaust comparison while blasting deportations
items.description: Rep. Hank Johnson, D-Ga., was mocked for appearing to compare deportations to the Holocaust.

items.title: Pope Don, &c.
items.description: On Trump and the GOP; capitalism and imperialism; the Epstein case; notable centenarians; and more.

items.title: America Must Lead in the Middle East with Strength, Not Slogans
items.description: U.S. leadership can’t be built on one-off deals or delusions of grand bargains.

items.title: Congress Should Decide Harvard’s Tax Exemption
items.description: The Supreme Court should never have made the president the arbiter of the community’s conscience in deciding when colleges must be taxed.

items.title: 94-year-old Warren Buffett isn’t retiring from Berkshire Hathaway and its $348 billion cash pile just yet
items.description: The billionaire will remain chairman of the board at Berkshire Hathaway when vice chairman Greg Abel takes over.

items.title: GOP leaders find new major holiday deadline for Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' amid Medicaid, tax divisions
items.description: Republicans are now hoping that Independence Day will serve as a good deadline to pass their plans for reconciliation.

items.title: 'MOGE' audit uncovers nonprofits' 'incredibly wasteful' spending of taxpayer funds: state official
items.description: Wasteful spending as far away as Manhattan was found in an audit of HIV/AIDS grants by Mississippi state auditor Shad White.

items.title: DHS to pay illegal immigrants $1,000 to self-deport
items.description: Homeland Security said Monday that it will pay a $1,000 reward to illegal immigrants who self-deport out of the U.S.

items.title: Warren Buffett credits Apple CEO Tim Cook with making ‘a lot more money than I’ve ever made’ for Berkshire Hathaway
items.description: Apple was a rare tech investment for Buffett, who always preferred to think of the iPhone-maker as a consumer goods company.

items.description: The nonsense we talk about vs. rare spiritual opportunities.

items.title: It Took Me Only 30 Seconds To Order Deadly Abortion Pills In A State Where They’re Illegal
items.description: Like an Amazon for abortion pills, Plan C proudly boasts it can help users obtain 'pills by mail in every state.'

items.title: Millions of student loan borrowers head to collections as delinquency rates soar over 20%

items.title: Wall Street slumps over Trump's latest tariff threat on films
items.description: President Trump's proposal to slap a 100% tariff on movies produced outside the U.S. reverberated across Wall Street markets Monday.

items.description: It’s time for the Trump administration to put back in place the safety regulations on mifepristone without delay.
